summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was a Document Control Clerk for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate her employment with the HSCA from at least October 1977 through February 1979. Her name appears on multiple payroll certifications and reports, confirming her position and salary during that period. One document specifically pertains to her payroll records, including authorizations, memos, and injury reports, suggesting the routine administrative aspects of her employment.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels's significance in the JFK assassination context is primarily related to her role as a staff member of the HSCA. As a Document Control Clerk, she likely handled sensitive information and contributed to the administrative functions of the committee's investigation. While the documents don't reveal specific contributions to the investigation's findings, her presence in payroll records and related documentation confirms her involvement in the HSCA's operations.
